Field.Label: INSTRUCTIONS: For the Receiver IP Address, make sure that you're receiver has the "Network Standby" mode turned on in the "Network Setup" menu. Once that's turned on, find the receiver's IP address. Using the receiver's included IR remote control, press the "RECEIVER" power button (top left of remote) to turn on the receiver if it isn't already on. Press the "RECEIVER" function button (middle right of remote) to ensure the next button presses are sent to the receiver and not another source device. Press the "HOME MENU" button. Use the up and down directional buttons to navigate to menu item 5 "Network Information." The first item on the Network Information screen will be the IP Address. Enter that address in the field above.

MCACC Memory Labels are optional and only used for display purposes (on control pages, etc). The lablels you enter here do not have to match the memory labels stored in the receiver's internal settings.
Note that, while other receiver models may not be listed, selecting one of the supported VSX models will likely work with most other networked Pioneer receivers.

INSTRUCTIONS: For the Receiver IP Address, make sure that you're receiver has the "Network Standby" mode turned on in the "Network Setup" menu. Once that's turned on, find the receiver's IP address. Refer to the VSX-1022-K Owner's Manual for instructions on how to find the IP address.

MCACC Memory Labels are optional and only used for display purposes (on control pages, etc). The lablels you enter here do not have to match the memory labels stored in the receiver's internal settings.
Note that, while other receiver models may not be listed, selecting one of the supported VSX models will likely work with most other networked Pioneer receivers.

INSTRUCTIONS: For the Receiver IP Address, make sure that you're receiver has the "Network Standby" mode turned on in the "Network Setup" menu. Once that's turned on, find the receiver's IP address. Using the receiver's included IR remote control, press the "RECEIVER" power button (top left of remote) to turn on the receiver if it isn't already on. Press the "RECEIVER" function button (middle right of remote) to ensure the next button presses are sent to the receiver and not another source device. Press the "HOME MENU" button. Use the up and down directional buttons to navigate to menu item 5 "Network Information." The first item on the Network Information screen will be the IP Address. Enter that address in the field above.

MCACC Memory Labels are optional and only used for display purposes (on control pages, etc). The lablels you enter here do not have to match the memory labels stored in the receiver's internal settings.

NOTES: 1) VSX-1122-K support is limited to Zones 1 and 2. 2) While other receiver models may not be listed, selecting one of the supported VSX models will likely work with most other networked Pioneer receivers.

INSTRUCTIONS: For the Receiver IP Address, make sure that you're receiver has the "Network Standby" mode turned on in the "Network Setup" menu. Once that's turned on, find the receiver's IP address. Using the receiver's included IR remote control, press the "RECEIVER" power button (top left of remote) to turn on the receiver if it isn't already on. Press the "RECEIVER" function button (middle right of remote) to ensure the next button presses are sent to the receiver and not another source device. Press the "HOME MENU" button. Use the up and down directional buttons to navigate to menu item 5 "Network Information." The first item on the Network Information screen will be the IP Address. Enter that address in the field above.

MCACC Memory Labels are optional and only used for display purposes (on control pages, etc). The lablels you enter here do not have to match the memory labels stored in the receiver's internal settings.

NOTES: 1) VSX-1123-K support is limited to Zones 1 and 2. 2) While other receiver models may not be listed, selecting one of the supported VSX models will likely work with most other networked Pioneer receivers.

INSTRUCTIONS: For the Receiver IP Address, make sure that you're receiver has the "Network Standby" mode turned on in the "Network Setup" menu. Once that's turned on, find the receiver's IP address. Using the receiver's included IR remote control, press the "RECEIVER" power button (top left of remote) to turn on the receiver if it isn't already on. Press the "RECEIVER" function button (middle right of remote) to ensure the next button presses are sent to the receiver and not another source device. Press the "HOME MENU" button. Use the up and down directional buttons to navigate to menu item 5 "Network Information." The first item on the Network Information screen will be the IP Address. Enter that address in the field above.

MCACC Memory Labels are optional and only used for display purposes (on control pages, etc). The lablels you enter here do not have to match the memory labels stored in the receiver's internal settings.

NOTES: 1) SC-75 support is limited to Zones 1 and 2. 2) While other receiver models may not be listed, selecting one of the supported SC or VSX models will likely work with most other networked Pioneer receivers.

INSTRUCTIONS: Select a Pioneer Receiver from the Receiver menu, then select the zone volume for that receiver that this Virtual Volume Controller will control. The Virtual Volume Controller device will appear in Indigo control pages and in Indigo Touch as a standard dimmer device and will allow you to control the selected Pioneer Receiver device volume like a dimmer.
